channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'They didn't like her': Bill Maher on Harris' presidential loss
item.description: On his show "Real Time," Bill Maher challenged journalists' explanations for Kamala Harris's presidential loss to Donald Trump. He dismissed claims that Harris lacked time to connect with voters, arguing that Americans found her unfavorable. Maher criticized attempts to attribute her defeat to sexism or racism, asserting that the public simply wasn't impressed with her campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK government scrambles to repair damage to UK-US special relationship caused by Labour supporting Harris and tweets attacking Trump
item.description: The UK government is navigating a diplomatic challenge as past criticisms of US President-elect Donald Trump by Labour Party members resurface. Trump's lawyers have called for an investigation into potential foreign interference related to Labour staff campaigning for Kamala Harris. Despite previous strong criticisms, Labour figures, including Keir Starmer and David Lammy, have reached out to Trump and emphasized the importance of the US-UK relationship.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: No 10 Diwali party serves alcohol and meat, leaves British Indians repulsed
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Diwali celebration at No. 10 Downing Street sparked controversy among British Indians. The inclusion of meat and alcohol in the menu drew criticism and was deemed disrespectful to the religious significance of the festival. Hindu groups expressed disappointment and urged for cultural sensitivity in future events.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Oprah Winfrey reportedly charged $1 million for hosting Harris' interview and campaign event
item.description: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign invested heavily in media appearances, including a $1 million payment to Oprah Winfrey for a rally and interview. Despite significant spending on events and podcasts, some critics argue these efforts failed to resonate with voters or distance Harris from the then-current administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No sex, no marriage: Women protest Trumpâ€™s win by boycotting relationships with men
item.description: Inspired by South Korea's "4B" movement, some American women are boycotting relationships with men and abstaining from sex in protest of Donald Trump's presidential victory. They cite concerns about reproductive rights and the rise in young male Republican voters as their reasons for participating in the movement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: German politician resigns after row over his post of sex doll with Nazi logo
item.description: Bulent Buyukbayram, a German politician, resigned after facing backlash for a controversial social media post. Buyukbayram shared an image of a sex doll dressed in a St. Pauli football club shirt, with a noose around its neck and offensive language referencing the Nazi SS symbol. The club, known for its progressive values and social activism, considered legal action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: WHO chief warns of imminent famine in Gaza, calls to scale up efforts
item.description: The World Health Organization's Director-General warned that famine in northern Gaza is imminent if humanitarian aid doesn't reach the area within days. A new report points to a rapidly deteriorating situation with limited aid shipments, skyrocketing food prices, and a collapse of livelihoods, pushing parts of northern Gaza into a worst-case scenario.

item.title: 'Baseless': Iran denies involvement in Trump assassination plot
item.description: Iran has denied US allegations of an assassination plot against former President Donald Trump. The US Justice Department alleges an Iranian official directed a plan involving surveillance and assassination of Trump in October 2024. The plot also targeted journalist Masih Alinejad. Three men face charges including murder-for-hire and conspiracy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sydney's 'mystery' toxic black beach balls turns out to be mini poop blobs
item.description: Mysterious black spherical objects, initially suspected to be tar balls, washed up on Sydney's eastern beaches in October, leading to closures. Scientists identified them as 'fatbergs,' a disgusting concoction of sewage, hair, oils, and other waste products.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California in ashes: Wildfire outside Los Angeles forces thousands to flee
Who is Farhad Shakeri, mastermind behind Iran's plot to kill President-elect Trump
item.description: The US Justice Department has unveiled charges against Farhad Shakeri, an Afghan national allegedly linked to Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, for plotting to assassinate former President Donald Trump during his 2016 campaign. Shakeri, who was deported from the US in 2008, allegedly received instructions and financial backing from an IRGC official to develop the assassination plan.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's five plans after becoming President
item.description: Elon Musk shared a video of former President Donald Trump outlining his plan to combat censorship and promote free speech. Trump's five-point strategy includes prohibiting federal partnerships for speech restriction, investigating censorship activities, holding tech corporations accountable, sanctioning universities involved in suppression, and establishing a "Digital Bill of Rights."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif congratulates Trump on X, community note claims 'unlawful VPN use'
item.description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif congratulated Donald Trump on winning a second term as US President in a tweet, despite having banned X in Pakistan. X users pointed out the irony, noting that Sharif was using a VPN to access the platform illegally.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Notre Dame's bells ring for first time after 5 years of silence since catastrophic fire
item.description: The eight bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang together for the first time since the 2019 fire, marking a significant step in the cathedral's restoration. The bells, housed in the northern belfry, underwent extensive repair and cleaning.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Candyman, Final Destination actor Tony Todd passes away at 69
item.description: Tony Todd, renowned for his chilling performance as Candyman and his contributions to the horror genre, passed away at 69. His career extended beyond horror, encompassing roles in Platoon, The Crow, and voice acting in video games like Spider-Man 2. Todd's legacy includes over 240 film and television appearances, leaving a lasting impact on the entertainment industry.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Qatar asks Hamas officials to leave country following pressure from US: Report
item.description: The US has urged Qatar to expel Hamas leaders. This follows Hamas's rejection of ceasefire and hostage exchange proposals. Qatar has asked Hamas leaders to leave. Qatar has hosted Hamas leaders since 2012 as part of a negotiation agreement. The US has expressed impatience with Qatar's ties to Hamas. Hamas officials deny receiving a formal request to leave Qatar.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Our relationship with India is much expanded': US defense secretary Lloyd Austin reflects on his 4-year tenure
item.description: US defense secretary Lloyd Austin emphasized the strengthening of global security alliances, particularly highlighting the growth of the US-India partnership. He acknowledged the Pentagon's focus on various regions, including the Indo-Pacific, while reaffirming support for Ukraine and addressing humanitarian concerns in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Parked vehicle with gas cylinders explodes on NYC street, damaging homes and cars, officials say
item.description: An SUV explosion in Queens, New York City, caused significant damage to nearby homes and vehicles. The explosion, captured on camera, was caused by the failure of a pressurized cylinder inside the vehicle, which was being used for construction and contained flammable materials. Thankfully, no injuries were reported.

item.title: US police arrest suspect in series of stabbings in Seattle
item.description: A man was arrested in downtown Seattle on Friday for allegedly stabbing five people. Police suspect he may also be responsible for five other stabbings in the same area since Thursday morning. The victims appear to have been targeted at random, with injuries ranging from minor cuts to serious stab wounds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The Handmaid's Tale' sales go up too...
